rice

appreciated, and if you know how to technically, I would like to hear.

 When you write a JUnit test, you have the full power of Java in your
>  ha=
nds. Thus, it is possible to do pretty much anything through a JUnit

t that you can do in Java--including polling a stock web service to

k that the stock price hasn't gone up. Whether it makes sense to

 a thing using JUnit, that's another question.
